A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
The Force was not strong with this one. Star Wars: The Last Jedi gets a 4.2/10 from The Cinema-Fan. As a fan of every Star Wars movie since A New Hope\, this was a surprisingly big letdown. The visuals are absolutely fantastic\, the cinematography is dope\, and the acting by Adam Driver is great. However\, The Last Jedi is a film that makes more sense the less you think about it.

 If you look at TLJ as a whole\, you will see unnecessary plot twists\, a severe lack of character development\, weird dialogue\, bad humor\, an absence of depth\, and completely pointless subplots. Very little is accomplished in the entire 2+ hours of the film. Almost everything before the concluding 25-30 minutes is inconsequential and ends up not mattering in the slightest. 

TLJ feels completely out of sync with The Force Awakens and this trilogy is beginning to feel like a battle between two directors who have 2 completely different visions. I don't necessarily view TLJ as a bad Star Wars movie as much as I view it as a bad movie in general.
